title: Biosecurity warning over loosely-regulated virus labs
description: Governments do not have controls to stop terrorists accessing labs and posing a biological threat.

title: The Motherload: How pandemic anger almost destroyed a mums' support group
description: Abusive messages from angry mums during lockdown almost caused the founder of The Motherload to close it down.

title: Coronavirus: The Indian children orphaned by Covid-19
description: Officially, hundreds of children have lost both their parents. Experts say the number may be much higher.

title: Metal, money, mystery: How Sanjeev Gupta built his empire
description: The UK helped metals tycoon Sanjeev Gupta save the country's last smelter. It was a lucrative deal.

title: War Horse actor salutes '80s gay Soho in one-man show
description: Jack Holden's play tells the story of a man diagnosed with HIV who decides to party his last days away.

title: Uganda: Finding the truth behind a killing spree in Kampala
description: BBC finds evidence Ugandan security forces killed unarmed people during a crackdown in November 2020.

title: James Barnor: The 91-year-old's photos bringing Ghana to life
description: Ghanaian-British photographer James Barnor's work is being exhibited at the Serpentine Gallery in London.

title: South Korea: From food wasters to recyclers
description: The country now recycles more than 95% of its food waste - how did they do it?

title: Moto3 rider Dupasquier dies after crash in qualifying
description: Swiss Moto3 rider Jason Dupasquier dies in hospital from injuries he sustained in a crash during Saturday's qualifying session in Italy.

title: France manhunt for armed ex-soldier who fired on police
description: Authorities tell residents to stay indoors as police hunt for the man who opened fire on police.

title: Boris Johnson marries Carrie Symonds at Westminster Cathedral
description: Downing Street says the wedding took place on Saturday afternoon "in a small ceremony".

title: Poots: European Union treating NI as a political plaything
description: The new DUP leader Edwin Poots has accused the European Union of damaging the NI peace process.

title: Osaka lets racquet do talking to reach French Open second round
description: Japan's Naomi Osaka puts the controversy over her refusal to speak to the media to one side as she starts the French Open with a straight-set win.

title: 'Optimism' Glasgow restrictions eased next week
description: The deputy first minister says he is hopeful the city will see Covid restrictions eased before the Euro 2020 tournament.

title: Kevin de Bruyne: Manchester City midfielder fractures nose and eye socket
description: Manchester City midfielder Kevin de Bruyne suffers fractured nose and eye socket in Champions League final defeat to Chelsea.

title: Are businesses really tackling racial inequality?
description: Are businesses doing enough to tackle racial inequalities in the boardroom and workplace?

title: South Western Ambulance Service declares 'critical incident'
description: South Western Ambulance Service blames "extreme pressures" for extended wait times for patients.

title: Travis Perkins warns of price rises amid shortage of raw materials
description: Industry-wide shortages mean the builders' merchant will charge more for cement, chipboard and paint.

title: Covid-19: 'Very few' Covid hospital patients had two jabs, NHS boss says
description: NHS boss Chris Hopson adds it's "incredibly striking" how busy hospitals are with non-Covid patients.

title: Partner of Tory peer's son held over Belize death
description: Jasmine Hartin, the partner of Lord Ashcroft's son, was discovered near the body of a police officer.

title: Jeremy Clarkson reveals 'heartache' filming farming TV series
description: The Grand Tour star is swapping cars for tractors as he embarks on his first solo TV show for Amazon.

title: Scottish toy designer Amy Corbett built dream career from Lego
description: Amy Corbett turned her childhood passion for creating into a design job and a US TV role as a 'brickmaster' judge.

title: Seal with bin bag wrapped round neck freed into wild
description: The seal was found at Walton-on-the-Naze in Essex with an "horrific" injury.

title: Afghan refugee found by motorway becomes architect
description: Salman Khan hopes to return to Afghanistan to help build schools.

title: Covid and jobs: Why are hospitality workers leaving the industry?
description: While employers hunt for chefs, waitresses and bar staff, some workers have called time on the sector.

title: Newspaper headlines: PM 'weds in secret' and Wuhan lab leak 'feasible'
description: The front pages are dominated by the 30-guest wedding of Boris Johnson and Carrie Symonds.

title: Plans for new national flagship to promote 'best of British'
description: The government plans to build a successor to Britannia in the UK, at a reported cost of about £200m.
